504520.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 504520
In-book reference  : Book 13, Hadith 520
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 13, Hadith 520
504520.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Abdullah ibn Abi Bakr ibn Amr ibn Hazm that he had heard Abbad ibn Tamim say that he had heard Abdullah ibn Zayd al-Mazini say, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, came out to the place of prayer and asked for rain, and when he faced the qibla he turned his cloak inside out."

504530.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 504530
In-book reference  : Book 13, Hadith 530
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 13, Hadith 530
504530.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Yahya ibn Said from Amr ibn Shuayb that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, when he asked for rain, "O Allah, give water to Your slaves and Your animals, and spread Your mercy, and give life to Your dead land."

504540.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 504540
In-book reference  : Book 13, Hadith 540
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 13, Hadith 540
504540.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Sharik ibn Abdullah ibn Abi Namir that Anas ibn Malik said, "A man came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said, 'Messenger of Allah, our animals are dying and our camels are too weak to travel, so make dua to Allah.' The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, made dua, and it rained on us from one jumua to the next."

504550.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 504550
In-book reference  : Book 13, Hadith 550
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 13, Hadith 550
504550.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Salih ibn Kaysan from Ubaydullah ibn Abdullah ibn Utba ibn Masud that Zayd ibn Khalid al- Juhani said, "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, took the subh prayer with us at Hudaybiyya after it had rained in the night. When he had finished he went up to the people and said, 'Do you know what your Lord has said?' They said, 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said, 'Some of my slaves have begun the morning believing in Me, and others have begun it rejecting Me. As for those who say, 'We were rained on by the overflowing favour of Allah and His mercy,' they believe in Me and reject the stars. But as for those who say, 'We were rained on by such and such a star, they reject Me and believe in the stars.' "

504560.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 504560
In-book reference  : Book 13, Hadith 560
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 13, Hadith 560
504560.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he had heard that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to say, "When a cloud appears from the direction of the sea and then goes towards ash-Sham, it will be an abundant source of rain."

504570.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 504570
In-book reference  : Book 13, Hadith 570
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 13, Hadith 570
504570.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he had heard that Abu Hurayra used to say, when morning came after it had rained on the people, "We have been rained upon by the rain of Allah's opening," and would then recite the ayat, "Whatever Allah opens to man of His mercy no-one can withhold, and whatever He withholds no-one can send forward after Him. " (Sura 35 ayat 2).
